intro: Tium drummondii, commonly known as the Drummond's tium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, oval fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Tium drummondii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands.
